newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakstan rupee ends down on devaluation, seen weak.
newsitem.headline: Pakstan rupee ends down on devaluation, seen weak.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee ended 0.10 rupees down at 42.70 to the dollar on Tuesday in the kerb after the State (central) Bank of Pakistan devalued the rupee by 7.86 percent against the dollar, dealers said.

"The rupee remained under pressure after the devaluation and demand for dollars was high," one dealer said. "The rupee will slip further against the dollar due to uncertainty about the strength of Pakistani currency."
The State (central) Bank of Pakistan (SBP) moved the rupee to 40.1200/40.3206 to the dollar from 36.9700/37.1549. It last changed the rate on September 10. -- Amir Zia 9221-5685192
